title: Update ZIKOLN copy and enhance pink accents

requirements.summary: Rewrite hero and about copy to the provided ZIKOLN bio in clear English (no duplication/awkward phrasing).
acceptanceCriteria: Hero section includes ZIKOLN name and “Graphic Designer” title in a prominent, readable way.

About section bio text includes: (1) 1+ years of experience, (2) emphasis on creativity and attention to detail, (3) specialties: Logos & Branding, Typography, Social Media Design, Motion Graphics, and (4) mastery of Adobe Creative Suite.
No duplicated sentence remains (e.g., the repeated “I have master Design tool such as Adobe Creative ...”).
All updated copy is written in clear English.

file_operations.description: Update hero headline/subheadline copy to prominently feature “ZIKOLN” and the “Graphic Designer” title; ensure all hero text reads naturally in English and removes awkward/duplicated phrasing.

Rewrite the About bio paragraph(s) to include 1+ years experience, creativity + attention to detail, specialties (Logos & Branding, Typography, Social Media Design, Motion Graphics), and mastery of Adobe Creative Suite; ensure final copy is clear English without repeated sentences.

requirements.summary: Replace placeholder identity strings with the name “ZIKOLN” in configuration and footer.
acceptanceCriteria: `frontend/src/content/siteConfig.ts` uses the name “ZIKOLN” instead of the current placeholder.
Footer displays “© [current year] ZIKOLN — Built in the Future” (year remains dynamic).
No other user-facing sections show the placeholder name (e.g., “Alex Rivera”).

file_operations.description: Replace the placeholder site name with “ZIKOLN” so any configuration-driven name usage reflects the correct identity.
Update the footer copyright line to render “© {currentYear} ZIKOLN — Built in the Future” while keeping the year dynamic.

requirements.summary: Increase pink/magenta accents across global theme and key UI highlights while preserving the existing neon futuristic aesthetic and reduced-motion behavior.
acceptanceCriteria: Pink/magenta accents are more noticeable across the UI (e.g., gradients, glow/shadow accents, borders, highlights) without reducing readability/contrast.
At least one primary gradient treatment (e.g., hero headline gradient and/or major section headings) includes a stronger pink presence.
At least one core component accent (e.g., GlassPanel neon accents, buttons, or similar highlights) uses the magenta/pink option in a visible way.
Changes respect reduced-motion behavior (no new mandatory animations that ignore prefers-reduced-motion).

file_operations.description: Adjust global theme variables and shared styling accents to increase pink/magenta presence (while maintaining contrast), including updating shared accent colors and any global highlight treatments (e.g., scrollbar gradient) without introducing new motion that bypasses prefers-reduced-motion.

Refine/extend Tailwind theme tokens (e.g., neon-pink shadow or related accent utilities) so pink/magenta glow accents are easier to apply consistently across sections while keeping the current neon aesthetic.

Strengthen pink/magenta in the hero’s primary gradient treatment and one key UI highlight (e.g., a button gradient/glow or scroll indicator border) while preserving readability and existing reduced-motion handling.

Use the GlassPanel component’s magenta/pink neon accent option (neonColor="magenta") in a prominent way and adjust nearby highlights (e.g., heading gradient or avatar glow) to increase visible pink accents while staying consistent with the overall neon theme.
